1.summary:
The FUSION plan combines dental and eye care benefits into a single, easy-to-administer package. This plan integrates the annual maximum between dental and vision plans, allowing members to use up to $1,000 toward any covered dental expense and up to $100 toward any covered eye care expense. The total benefits paid between the two coverages will not exceed $1,000. The dental plan benefits are categorized into three types: Type 1 Preventive, Type 2 Basic, and Type 3 Major, all with no waiting period. Type 1 Preventive covers routine exams, bitewing X-rays, and cleanings at 100%. Type 2 Basic includes restorative amalgams, composites, nonsurgical endodontics, and simple extractions, also at 100%. Type 3 Major covers surgical extractions, nonsurgical periodontics, crowns, surgical endodontics, surgical periodontics, and prosthodontics at 100% as well.

The deductible for Type 1 services is $0, while for Type 2 and 3 services, it is $50 per person per calendar year, with a family maximum of $150 per calendar year. The benefit year maximum for all types is $1,000 per person, per calendar year. The claims allowance is based on the maximum covered expense, with in-network allowances being discounted fees. This plan provides a structured approach to managing dental and eye care expenses, ensuring members have access to necessary preventive and major services without waiting periods.

2.summary:
This page outlines the vision and dental plan benefits available to members, including specific allowances and frequencies for various services. Vision plan benefits are subject to the FUSION plan design, with allowances for exams, lenses, and frames, all subject to maximums. Specific lens types such as bifocal, trifocal, and progressive are also covered under these maximums. The plan includes a lifetime deductible of $0 for certain services. Members are encouraged to submit claims within 90 days of the date of service to ensure consideration by the plan.

The dental rewards program allows members to grow their annual maximum benefit by submitting at least one dental claim per year. If total dental benefits paid are under $500, members can carry over $250 in rewards to the following year. Additional rewards are available for using Ameritas network providers, with a potential maximum reward accumulation of $1000. However, if no dental claim is submitted within a year, rewards are reset.

Provider flexibility is emphasized, allowing members to choose any dentist, with network dentists offering savings up to 30% below regional averages. The Ameritas dental network is extensive, providing over 428,000 access points nationwide. Late entrants, those who enroll after initially declining, face a 12-month waiting period for most benefits, except for evaluations, cleanings, and fluoride applications.

3.summary:
This page provides information on member savings and customer service details for the National Congress of Employers plan. Members can access prescription savings through a network of over 60,000 pharmacies, including major chains like Walgreens and Walmart. The plan offers up to 65% savings on generic prescriptions and an average of 40% savings on brand name prescriptions. Additionally, members can save on frames and lenses at Walmart Vision Centers, with discounts up to 35% on eyewear frames and lenses. The plan includes benefits such as frames for the entire family, a wide selection of lens options, and safety eyewear. Walmart Vision Centers offer guarantees like a 60-day frame and lens satisfaction guarantee, a 12-month replacement guarantee on broken or damaged frames or lenses, and lifetime adjustments and cleanings.

Customer service is available through Customer Connections at 800-487-5553 or www.Ameritas.com, with operating hours from Monday to Thursday, 7am to 12am CST, and Friday, 7am to 6:30pm CST. The document notes that it is a highlight of plan benefits provided by Ameritas Life Insurance Corp. and advises contacting the benefits administrator for a complete list of covered procedures, exclusions, and limitations.

rows: Routine Exam (1 per 6 months), Bitewing X-rays (1 per 12 months), Cleaning (1 per 6 months)
Restorative Amalgams, Restorative Composites, Endodontics (nonsurgical), Simple Extractions
Surgical Extractions, Periodontics (nonsurgical), Crowns (1 in 10 years per tooth), Endodontics (surgical), Periodontics (surgical), Prosthodontics (Bridges, Dentures) (1 in 10 years)
Type 1, 2, and 3 (per person, per calendar year)

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Ameritas Dental Plan. We'll walk through the plan's features and benefits that empower your health with financial peace of mind. Let's get started!

---- Plan Overview ----

Understanding the details and benefits of the Ameritas Dental Plan

begins with its comprehensive coverage through Ameritas. 

The plan includes preventive care for routine check-ups, 

as well as basic and major services with extensive support. 

Additionally, vision benefits are available through the integrated FUSION plan, 

and network savings support is also provided.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

Let's explore the key features and benefits of this plan.

The plan offers preventive care, 

basic services, 

and major services, which vary by plan. 

Vision benefits are also available through Ameritas.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

Now, let's discuss the cost management tools available with this plan.

The Dental Rewards Program, or DRP, 

is a key feature, along with the annual maximum system, 

and network savings support.

---- How Dental Rewards Program Works ----

Here's how the Dental Rewards Program works.

First, you enroll through Ameritas. 

Then, submit at least one dental claim per year. 

If benefits paid are under five hundred dollars, you can carry over two hundred fifty dollars in rewards. 

Additional rewards are available for using network providers, 

and you can accumulate up to one thousand dollars in rewards.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

Preventive care and wellness are essential components of the plan.

Routine exams services are included, 

along with cleaning and X-rays programs. 

The Ameritas Network provides extensive coverage.

---- Telehealth Services ----

Telehealth services are an important part of the plan.

Virtual consultations are available, 

with twenty-four seven access. 

Prescription services are also available, 

and you have remote access to care.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

Advocacy and support services are here to assist you.

The plan offers comprehensive healthcare advocacy, 

claims assistance support, 

provider options flexibility, 

and customer service support.

---- Plan Tier 1 (One of Two) ----

Let's examine our first plan tier.

Type 1 Preventive includes preventive care, 

such as routine exams, bitewing X-rays, and cleaning. 

Coverage is one hundred percent for all services.

---- Plan Tier 1 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with our first plan tier.

The deductible is zero dollars for Type 1 services, 

and the benefit year maximum is one thousand dollars per person, per calendar year.

---- Plan Tier 2 (One of Two) ----

Now, let's look at our second plan tier.

Type 2 Basic includes basic services, 

such as restorative amalgams, restorative composites, endodontics (nonsurgical), and simple extractions. 

Coverage is one hundred percent for all services.

---- Plan Tier 2 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with our second plan tier.

The deductible is fifty dollars per person, per calendar year, 

and the family maximum is one hundred fifty dollars per calendar year.

---- Plan Tier 3 (One of Two) ----

Let's examine our third plan tier.

Type 3 Major includes major services, 

such as surgical extractions, periodontics (nonsurgical), and crowns (one in ten years per tooth). 

Coverage is one hundred percent for all services.

---- Plan Tier 3 (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with our third plan tier.

The deductible is fifty dollars per person, per calendar year, 

and the benefit year maximum is one thousand dollars per person, per calendar year.

---- Vision Plan (One of Two) ----

Now, let's look at the vision plan.

Vision benefits include exams, lenses, frames, bifocal, trifocal, and progressive lenses. 

Coverage is subject to maximums.

---- Vision Plan (Two of Two) ----

Continuing with the vision plan.

The lifetime deductible is zero dollars for certain services, 

and network savings can be up to thirty percent below regional averages.

---- Comparing Plan Tiers ----

Let's compare the different tiers available.

Type 1 Preventive, Type 2 Basic, and Type 3 Major all offer one hundred percent coverage, 

while the vision plan coverage is subject to maximums. 

The deductible for Type 1 is zero dollars, while Type 2 and 3 have a fifty-dollar deductible per person. 

The benefit year maximum is one thousand dollars for dental plans, and the vision plan is integrated with dental. 

Network savings are up to thirty percent for all plans, and there are no waiting periods.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

Preventive care includes routine exams and cleanings, as well as bitewing X-rays. 

Basic services cover restorative procedures and simple extractions. 

Major services include surgical procedures, crowns, and prosthodontics. 

Vision services cover exams, lenses, and frame allowances.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

Here are the key points to remember.

The plan offers broad coverage benefits, 

with no waiting periods included. 

Network savings benefits are available, 

and enrollment is required.

---- Closing ----

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you assist members in making informed decisions about their health coverage. Continue to be great!

slide.content:
<SlideAudio deckKey="FEN_AMER" />

# Ameritas Dental Plan Overview

Understanding the details and benefits of the **Ameritas Dental Plan**

</v-click>

script.content:
Here are the key points to remember.

The plan offers broad coverage benefits, 

with no waiting periods included. 

Network savings benefits are available, 

and enrollment is required.

slide.content: # Thank You! Continue to be great!
slide.frontmatter:
transition: fade-out
layout: end
line: Thank you for participating in the Ameritas Dental Review. Continue to be great!

script.content: Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you assist members in making informed decisions about their health coverage. Continue to be great!
